verses.roman:
śrī-śuka uvāca
astiḥ prāptiś ca kaṁsasya
mahiṣyau bharatarṣabha
mṛte bhartari duḥkhārte
īyatuḥ sma pitur gṛhān

synonyms: śrī-śukaḥ uvāca—Śukadeva Gosvāmī said; astiḥ prāptiḥ ca—Asti and Prāpti; kaṁsasya—of Kaṁsa; mahiṣyau—the queens; bharata-ṛṣabha—O hero of the Bhāratas (Parīkṣit); mṛte—having been killed; bhartari—their husband; duḥkha—with unhappiness; ārte—distressed; īyatuḥ sma—they went; pituḥ—of their father; gṛhān—to the house.
translation: Śukadeva Gosvāmī said: When Kaṁsa was killed, O heroic descendant of Bharata, his two queens, Asti and Prāpti, went to their father's house in great distress.
